titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Brinsley Sheridan Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 03:00
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Richard Brinsley Sheridan collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection contains letters by, to and concerning Sheridan, including letters by Sheridan to Robert Barclay, the Duke of Bedford, and Samuel Whitehead; and writings by Sheridan, including four manuscript copies of the School for Scandal, one with annotations and corrections in Sheridan's hand; a holograph draft of a comic opera, The Foresters; and notes for Affectation, a projected comedy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Richard Brinsley Sheridan Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Brinsley Sheridan Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, it has been noted in the box-and-folder list. This finding aid will be updated periodically to account for new materials that may be added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been added since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to Richard Brinsley Sheridan, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Materials incorporated into the collection prior to July 1997 have been organized into three series: Correspondence, Writings, and Other Papers.

did.unittitle: Correspondence
BANNISTER, JOHN
ALS to Samuel Cartwright

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: GRAHAM, J.
ALS to an unidentified recipient, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. with endorsement.
22 cm.
With a note by Richard Brinsley
Sheridan.
Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: NICHOLLS, SARAH
ALS to Richard Brinsley Sheridan, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. with address, 20 cm.
Sheridan's maidservant writes to
ask for money on which to live
while he is away from London.
Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: PALMER, ROBERT
ALS to the management of Drury Lane [Richard Brinsley Sheridan], London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. 21 cm.
Requesting continuance of his
employment at the theatre.

did.unittitle: SHERIDAN, ELIZABETH (LINLEY)
3 ALS and 1 AL (in the third person) to Richard Peake

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p. with addresses. 18-19 cm.
Concerning personal financial
matters.
Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: SHERIDAN, RICHARD BRINSLEY BUTLER
ALS to Robert Barclay, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. with address, 24 cm.
Paper watermarked 1805.
Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: Franked piece of paper addressed to "Miss Beddyke, 10 Grosvenor Place", London
ALS to Francis Russell, Duke of Bedford (the Marquis of Tavistock)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. with envelope.
Gift, 1948.

did.unittitle: 2 ALS to Mr. Burgess, Farnham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Both letters with address. Paper of
first letter watermarked 1813.
Engraving of a portrait of R.B.
Sheridan laid in folder.
Gift, 1937.

did.unittitle: ALS to "Dear Burgess"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1964.

did.unittitle: ALS to Thomas Holloway, [London]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. with address, 23 cm.
Draft of Holloway's reply on p. [3]
Concerning the debts of Mr. Shaw,
orchestra conductor at Drury Lane
Theatre.
Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: ALS to [Richard Peake?]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p. 24 cm.
Gift.

did.unittitle: ALS to Mr. Peake (?), Winchester

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1964.

did.unittitle: ALS to Mr. Shaw, Chancery Lane

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1964.

did.unittitle: 2 ALS to Hester (Ogle) Sheridan, London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters to his wife dated 1800 September 5 and "seven 1804." Accompanied by letter from Clare Sheridan, 1937 December 18 to George Nettleton, Yale College Office of the Dean, and reply from Nettleton (copy) dated 1938 January 3. Gift, 1937.

did.unittitle: ALS to Charles Ward

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1962.

did.unittitle: ADft. of letter to Samuel Whitehead

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Purchase, 1959.

did.unittitle: ALS to an unidentified recipient
Writings
SHERIDAN, RICHARD BRINSLEY BUTLER
AFFECTATION: autograph manuscript notes for a projected comedy, written on 28 pages and the endpapers of a small, leather-bound memorandum book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
11.5 x 18 cm. In a red cloth slip
case.

did.unittitle: THE CARAVAN: manuscript play in an unidentified hand with alterations in the hand of Sheridan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
40 p. 15 x 23.5 cm. Bound in three-
quarter green leather.
Autograph of J.W. Connolly, Oct. 12,
1858.
Gift, 1947.

did.unittitle: THE CRITIC, OR A TRAGEDY REHEARS'D: manuscript prompt copy in an unidentified hand, with a few manuscript corrections by Sheridan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
124 p. 23 cm.
Presentation inscription from
Sheridan to Mrs. Crewe; bookplate
of Sophie Hall-Walker.
Bound in 3/4 green morocco.
Purchase, 1954.

did.unittitle: THE FORESTERS: autograph manuscript draft of a comic opera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
9 leaves, inlaid. 18-24 cm.
The play was never produced.
Gift, 1954.

did.unittitle: PISCATORY PARTY. IN COMMEMORATION OF ISAAC WALTON. Autograph manuscript, signed, of the rules and regulations drawn up by Sheridan and presented to the Walton & Cotton Club. Probably compiled sometime before 1803.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
10 p.
Accompanied by an autograph note
stating the authenticity of the
manuscript and signed by W[illiam]
Dunn, 22 Charlotte Street, Bedford
Square, May 9, 1814.
Bound by Sangorski and Sutcliffe in
full green morocco with special
title-page, transcript, and extract
of a description of the manuscript
which appeared in The Field, Sept.
28, 1907.
Gift, 1947.

did.unittitle: THE SCHOOL FOR SCANDAL: manuscript made by four copyists with numerous corrections in Sheridan's hand and a note signed by him, submitting the play for licensing to William Chetwynd early in 1777.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
140 p. 19 x 24 cm.
With David Garrick's Prologue, and
George Colman's Epilogue.
AN signed George Chetwynd, on fly-
leaf. Grandon Hall, [England] Sept.
10, 1834.
This manuscript was damaged by fire
in the bookbinding establishment of
Fairburn, on February 26, 1834; the
leaves of the ms were subsequently
inlaid and bound in blind tooled
russia with the arms of Sir George
Chetwynd stamped on front and back
covers.
Three engraved portraits (2 of
Sheridan and 1 of Mrs. Frances
Abington) and several contemporary
newspaper clippings bound in as
preliminary leaves.
Autographs of Wm. Chetwynd and
Frances Brookes; bookplates of Sir
George Chetwynd, Robert J. Collier,
and Augustin Daly.
Gift, 1947.

did.unittitle: "THE SCHOOL FOR SCANDAL: A Comedy. As perform'd at the Theatre Royal Drury Lane...1777" Manuscript copy in an unidentified handwriting, probably used as a promptbook. The notes of authorship at the head of the "Prologue" and of the "Epilogue" are in Sheridan's autograph. Formerly the property of Albinia Bertie Hobart, Countess of Buckinghamshire, with her signature, "Albinia Buckinghamshire".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Bound in three-quarter red morocco.
p. i-iv; 1-215; [i-ii].
Purchase, 1936.

did.unittitle: THE SCHOOL FOR SCANDAL: manuscript copy in a contemporary unidentified hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
199 ff. 22.5 cm.
With David Garrick's Prologue and
George Colman's Epilogue.
The name of the former owner,
Charles Laurence, is lettered in a
Gothic hand on flyleaf.
Bound in polished calf.
Gift, 1951.

did.unittitle: THE SCHOOL FOR SCANDAL: Manuscript copy, written in a contemporary hand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
141 folio l. written on one side of
the paper.
The paper is watermarked 1795.
Gift, 1932.

did.unittitle: Other Papers
SHERIDAN, RICHARD BRINSLEY BUTLER

ALGEBRA 1769: autograph manuscript
notebook kept by Sheridan while a
student at Harrow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
146 p. 16 x 19.5 cm. Bound in
contemporary vellum. Lettered on
spine: Alg. Vol I. R. B. S.
"Charles Brinsley, the son of
Sheridan by his second marriage,
has recorded that his father left
behind him 'six copybooks each
filled with notes and references to
mathematics, carefully written by
Mr. S. at an early age'..."
Gift, 1947.

did.unittitle: MEMORANDUM FOR THE PRIVATE BOXES AT DRURY LANE THEATRE: autograph manuscript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
Note on verso of second leaf, in an
unidentified hand: "Mr. Sheridans
memorandum...made at Hommenley in
Janry 1797"
Accompanied by two floor plans,
entitled "Design for an additional
private box and setting back the
boxes" and "Plan of the orchestra
boxes."
Gift, 1951.

did.unittitle: Notes for a speech on the Volunteers, made before the House of Commons: autograph manuscript, [London]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p. 9-12 cm.
Speech published in Speeches of
Sheridan, London, Patrick Martin,
1816; V, 240.
Purchase, 1955.
